SEARCH
Module FloWeekTracker
Package com.floweektracker.main

Class MainPanelUI

java.lang.Object
com.floweektracker.main.MainPanelUI
class MainPanelUI extends Object
Represents the UI of the main panel displayed to the user after launching the application. It contains the main components of the application: title, planner and buttons.

Fields:
  • plannerTableManager - a reference to a new PlannerTableManager instance which contains the DefaultTableModel for the planner and manages its data and updates
  • mainPanel - a reference to a new JPanel instance containing the main panel's components
  • infoButton - a JButton reference to the button that displays information about the app to the user
  • planner - a JTable reference containing the UI of the planner
  • buttons - an array of JButton references for buttons that allow interaction with the planner
Methods:
  • configureMainPanel() - adds panels and components to the mainPanel and configures it
  • createInfoButton() - creates the infoButton to display information about the app
  • createTitlePanel() - creates a JPanel with the app's name and the infoButton
  • createButtonsPanel() - creates a JPanel with the buttons for interacting with the application
  • createBottomInfo() - creates a JLabel with information displayed at the bottom of the app

Getters: getMainPanel(), getInfoButton(), getButtons(), getPlanner(), getPlannerTableManager()

      private final JPanel mainPanel
      Contains an instance of the JPanel representing the main panel shown to the user initially after launching the application. It displays the app's title, week planner, buttons, and information at the bottom of the window.

  • Constructor Details

    • MainPanelUI

      MainPanelUI()
      Constructs a new MainPanelUI instance. This constructor also initializes references to the plannerTableManager, mainPanel, infoButton, planner, and buttons. At the end, the constructor invokes the configureMainPanel() method to configure the mainPanel.
      See Also:
      • createInfoButton()
      • PlannerTableManager.getPlanner()
      • ButtonsText
      • Main

  • Method Details

    • configureMainPanel

      private void configureMainPanel()
      Configures a mainPanel by setting layout and name. It also adds components to it.

      The main panel's layout is set to a vertical BoxLayout. The panel is then named "MainPanel" for identification purposes. This method adds the following components to the main panel in order:
      • A title panel, created by createTitlePanel()
      • The planner component, referenced by planner
      • A buttons panel, created by createButtonsPanel()
      • Bottom information, created by createBottomInfo()
      See Also:
      • MainPanelUI()

    • createInfoButton

      private JButton createInfoButton()
      Creates a JButton with an ImageIcon retrieved from resources. If the image is successfully loaded, it will be scaled and set as the icon for the new JButton instance, which will then be configured and returned. If loading the image fails, the user will see an JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE and null will be returned. If this method produces a NullPointerException, make sure that info.png is in the resources.
      Returns:
      a JButton with the ImageIcon, or null if loading the ImageIcon fails.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the resource /info.png is not found.
      See Also:
      • infoButton
      • MainPanelUI()
      • createTitlePanel()
      • MainListeners

    • createTitlePanel

      private JPanel createTitlePanel()
      Creates and returns a JPanel containing the app's title represented by a JLabel, and the infoButton. This panel is used as a part of the user interface setup in the configureMainPanel() method.
      Returns:
      a JPanel displaying the app's title and the infoButton
      See Also:
      • createInfoButton()

    • createButtonsPanel

      private JPanel createButtonsPanel()
      Creates and returns a JPanel containing buttons, which are used for interaction with the application. This panel is used as a part of the user interface setup in the configureMainPanel() method.
      Returns:
      a JPanel displaying interactive buttons.

    • createBottomInfo

      private JLabel createBottomInfo()
      Creates and returns a JLabel containing instructions about how to access more details about application. This panel is used as a part of the user interface setup in the configureMainPanel() method.
      Returns:
      a JPanel displaying instructors for accessing more information about the app
